abstract: The deal would give Intel a foothold in the smartphone chip market, a segment of the wireless business that is experiencing strong growth.
snippet: The deal would give Intel a foothold in the smartphone chip market, a segment of the wireless business that is experiencing strong growth.
lead_paragraph: Less than two weeks after saying it would buy McAfee, Intel announced Monday that it would acquire the wireless business of the German chip maker Infineon for about $1.4 billion in cash.

headline.main: Intel to Buy a Wireless Division of Infineon
headline.print_headline: Intel to Buy A Wireless Division Of Infineon

byline.original: By Chris V. Nicholson and Andrew Ross Sorkin
